game_description: GORN is a ludicrously violent VR gladiator simulator, made by Free Lives, the developers of Broforce and Genital Jousting. Featuring a unique, fully physics driven combat engine, GORN combatants will be able to creatively execute their most violent gladiatorial fantasies in virtual reality. Savagely strike down an infinite supply of poorly-animated opponents with all manner of weapons – from swords, maces, and bows to nunchuks, throwing knives, massive two-handed warhammers or even your blood-soaked bare hands. The only limits to the carnage are your imagination and decency, in the most brutal and savage VR face-smashing game ever produced by man.
Languages: English, French (France), German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Polish, Russian, Spanish (Spain)
review_1: I got this game about 2 years ago and i still love it. Alot of times i come back here and replay the story and play custom snd endless. But the only flaw is that the game doesnt get updated anymore. Yes without the updates its still a AMAZING game but i do wish it got added some More levels, still 10/10 I really hope this helped and if it did, hit that thumbs up diwn below
review_3: Honestly, I have never played such an amazing game, here is a list of ratings, Gore: 10/10 Npcs: 10/10 Weapons: 10/10 Modes: 10/10 Graphics: 10/10 FUN:1000000/10 Please get this game it is so good and will be enjoyed by nearly everyone that installed the game I can’t exaggerate enough how good the game is.

review_5: "Mom? You know how It's my birthday today? Well, there is this aviation game I really want! Could I have some Oculus credit?" Mom: "Sure!" Me: "Thanks mom! Alright, let's get this game... Gorn? What's that? This is a hard decision, maybe I will try it and then refund it. It's been a few days since my birthday, the story above is how this played out. It has been WAY past the 2 hour refund cap, meaning no refunds. But I don't need refunds. Playing this game for the first time was a very different experience than other games. No lengthy tutorial for me to sit through. Just immediately thrown into battle. Now this was natural, and it just felt good! When I play GORN I find myself roleplaying, I NEVER roleplay, but here I am giving the audience a lecture about how watching people brutally murdering others is wrong and that they will pay, telling the fighters that they are cowards, and yelling uncontrollably to assert my dominance. The style of this game tricks the playful side of me into thinking I really am fighting. I lift weights and that has never caused me to sweat to this degree. If my parents weren't around to tell me to be quiet I would never even notice it's a game until my headset dies, and I have a battery pack meaning the headset lasts for hours. Campaign mode (If your as savage as me) gives you about 5 hours of play time, but custom really gives an infinite playtime. I leave the game, play something else, but then my blood lust has me coming back every time. Even playing the levels again. Endless mode is a blast! If you are hoping to get an aviation game for your birthday and stumbled across this game, please get GORN instead. You really, really, won't regret it. If you feel like this was a little bit helpful explaining how wonderful this game is click that little button down there! You know you want to! But really, GORN couldn't be a better choice. Now please excuse me, I will return to pulling other fighters hearts out with wolverine claws.
